link.synopsis: Enrique Suarez (Nestor Carbonell, who also wrote the screenplay) is a supporting actor on a mediocre sitcom in this day-in-the-life showbiz comedy. When Suarez makes an appearance at the opening of a Houston K-Mart, the entire trip turns out to be a disaster: His limo driver in Los Angeles criticizes his accent on the show; a soap opera star wants to chat philosophy; and his Houston appearance	 is a bust.
link.title: synopsis
Who's That Knocking at My Door?
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story

link.synopsis: Left penniless by a cruel husband, a single mother (Maggie Cheung) who's an artist by day must drive a taxicab through the streets of San Francisco by night to make ends meet and to support her 10-year-old son (Scott Leung). But her life takes an abrupt turn when she picks up a hotshot, dot-com entrepreneur (Leon Lai) with a penchant for one-night stands in this romantic comedy from director Andrew Lau.
link.title: synopsis
The Map of Sex and Love

link.synopsis: Instead of going the raunchy comedy route, Body Shots takes a serious, sometimes-graphic look at the sex lives of young people in the Los Angeles fast lane: a night of hard partying for four guys and four girls at the town's trendiest spots. The results? New hook-ups, fresh regrets and scandal when Sara (Tara Reid) accuses football star Mike (Jerry O'Connell) of date rape. Sean Patrick Flanery and Amanda Peet co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Confessions of a Young American Housewife
A Good Day to Be Black & Sexy
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail

link.synopsis: Bob Hope stars as Sgt. O'Farrell in this seaworthy comedy about a wayward Japanese torpedo that's hit a cargo ship full of beer. O'Farrell takes it upon himself to "rescue" the lager while delivering some nurses to his officers. To the boys' surprise, however, all but one of the nurses -- Nurse Nellie Krause (Phyllis Diller) -- turn out to be men. Hope and Diller repeat their successful pairing from Boy, Did I Get A Wrong Number.
link.title: synopsis
A Guide for the Married Man
It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World
The Return of the Pink Panther
Suppose They Gave a War and Nobody Came?
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series
Monty Python and the Holy Grail

title.regular: The Private Navy of Sgt. O' Farrell
title.short: The Private Navy of Sgt. O' Farrell

link.synopsis: In their fifth "road" comedy, Bob Hope and Bing Crosby are framed for starting a fire and hop a boat to Rio de Janeiro. Naturally, they meet Dorothy Lamour there and must rescue her from her evil aunt (Gale Sondergaard, the queen of movie evil aunts). Bing serenades Dorothy with "But Beautiful," and even the Andrews Sisters show up to croon a tune. This was the last "road" picture until Road to Bali in 1952.
link.title: synopsis
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
Rhythm on the Range / Rhythm on the River: Double Feature
The Three Stooges: All the World's a Stooge
Take Me Out to the Ball Game
Here Comes Cookie / Love in Bloom / Six of a Kind: Triple Feature
Bob Hope: The Road to Laughter
I Was a Male War Bride
Sorrowful Jones / The Paleface: Double Feature

link.synopsis: Stranded on a distant planet after their school closes, new teacher Ayako and her pupil Wakano try to return to Earth by teaming up with the mysterious Paraila, whose shady past brings the trio serious problems from the police and gangsters. Mixing sci-fi, comedy and action, this anime series follows the three women as they evade cold-blooded killers and watch their situation frequently go from bad to worse.
link.title: synopsis
All Purpose Cultural Cat Girl Nuku Nuku Dash
Tenchi the Movie 2: The Daughter of Darkness
Tenchi Forever: Tenchi Muyo in Love 2
Di Gi Charat: Original TV Series
Urusei Yatsura Ova 1: Inaba the Dreammaker
Burn Up Excess: Vol. 1: To Serve and Protect
Burn Up Excess: Vol. 4: The Case of the Black Diamonds

link.synopsis: In the remote alpine village of Tolzbad, residents not only suppress their voices to avoid avalanches, but also their darkest secrets and desires. When shocking revelations of murder and incest surface, the town begins to disintegrate. Directed by filmmaker Guy Maddin, this surreal dark comedy is shot in the style of classic German Expressionist films and includes a deliberately rough soundtrack.
link.title: synopsis
Twilight of the Ice Nymphs / Archangel
Dracula: Pages from a Virgin's Diary
The Saddest Music in the World
The Lon Chaney Collection: The Unknown
Mishima: A Life in Four Chapters

link.synopsis: In this comedy, the Tredeci clan's misfortune has gone on for three generations, from their start in Italy to their current home on an Indiana produce farm. Bob (Marc Grapey) is the first of the brood to be born stateside and will inherit the family business. Only problem is, Bob isn't interested and heads to New York to become famous. But when his father gets sick, he must return home before his cousin Greg (Jeff Puckett) takes the farm away.
link.title: synopsis
Vidas Privadas / Pantaleon Y Las Visitadores
Three Men and a Little Lady

link.synopsis: Thanks to his hardworking parents, Jimmy Reardon (River Phoenix) attends a wealthy school, where he's made friends with all the rich kids. On the eve of graduation, his girlfriend (Meredith Salenger) and his buddies (Matthew Perry and Ione Skye) are all leaving him behind. But Jimmy has one night to destroy his relationship, a few friendships -- and his father's car. This teen comedy was Phoenix's first starring role.
link.title: synopsis
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love

title.regular: A Night in the Life of Jimmy Reardon
title.short: A Night in the Life of Jimmy Reardon

link.synopsis: Raj (Govinda) considers himself to be the best detective in the business. But he hasn't used those skills to solve the mystery of his dismal romantic life. That's about to change, however, when a trip to Europe leads him to beautiful vacationer Anjali (Rani Mukherjee) and her family. But as love blossoms, another mystery threatens to dash his hopes of happiness. This musical comedy from D.D. Kashyap features songs by Shankar-Jaikishen.
link.title: synopsis
Jis Desh Men Ganga Behti Hai

link.synopsis: Karthik is a wealthy young man who actively leads a bachelor's life, with great encouragement from his father. But when he meets the beautiful and practical Suvalakshmi, his life is turned upside down -- and his view of bachelorhood will change forever. This touching romantic comedy from director Agathiyan features music by Deva, including the songs "Andhi Mandharai," "Endhan Kural" and "Gogulatthil Kanna Kanna."
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this sexy, supernatural anime comedy, angry spirits are on the loose at Heian University, terrorizing teachers and students alike. To the rescue comes astrology student Kocho Enoki -- with curves and magical powers aplenty -- to try to subdue them. While her charms (and those of her accommodating sister Koran) may be enough to distract the evil male spirits, when a female demon attacks, Kocho and her fellow ghostbusters are stymied.
link.title: synopsis
Legend of Himiko #3: Sword of Seven Blades
Ah My Buddha: Vol. 1: The Aroused One
InuYasha: The Movie: Affections Touching Across Time
InuYasha: The Movie 3: Swords of an Honorable Ruler
Fullmetal Alchemist: The Movie: Conqueror of Shamballa
Bleach: Memories of Nobody: The Movie
Dragon Ball Z: The World's Strongest
Dragon Ball Z: The Dead Zone

link.synopsis: When Japanese soldiers kidnap a group of generals, the Chinese offer a reward to the roguish Don Wen (Jimmy Wang Yu) if he can return the captives alive. Now, Wen and his motley band of miscreants -- including a con man, an escape artist, a thief and an ex-wrestler -- must fight their way behind enemy lines to make a profit. This Dirty Dozen-style comedy co-stars Jackie Chan and Brigitte Lin.
link.title: synopsis
Half a Loaf of Kung Fu
Deadly Snail vs. Kung Fu Killer
Crash Masters: The Dragon, the Hero
Rarescope: Choi Lee Fut Kung Fu
Black Dragon Collection: Of Cooks and Kung Fu
The Challenge of Master Killer / Shaolin Monks
The Chinese Godfather / Duel of Karate
The Gambling Ghost / Hidden Enforcers / Mandarin Magician / Burger Cop

link.synopsis: A few years out of college, Dave (Josh Hamilton) hasn't made any kind of mark on the world. He hates his retail job, he can't keep his car running, his ex-girlfriend (Arabella Field) is back in town, and now it seems like his stoner best buddy (Steve Zahn) is finally getting a life. Dave's also a bit confused about his relationship with his co-worker Nichole (Heather McComb), who's still in high school. Paul Todisco directs this slacker comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Sonic Youth: Corporate Ghost: The Videos 1990-2002
Val Lewton: I Walked with a Zombie / The Body Snatcher
Drive Thru History: Greece and the Word
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down

link.synopsis: In this spirited comedy, a gifted young pianist who has everything going for her sees her life unravel: Her moment of glory is snatched from her before it begins, her boyfriend ditches her, and she's forced to move in with her crazy parents.
link.title: synopsis
The Monster That Challenged the World / It! The Terror from Beyond Space
Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human
Smiling Fish and Goat on Fire

link.synopsis: In this classic romantic comedy, Shashi Kapoor plays Ashok Verma, a young man who loses his job but gains a girlfriend in the process. When Verma finds himself out on the street after getting fired, he decides to launch a protest by camping outside the boss's house. This earns him a bucket of water over his head -- but also an introduction to the big guy's daughter. Romance ensues, but problems arise when it comes time to meet the girl's parents.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: While away at college, wealthy Mohan (Jeetendra) falls in love with pretty Nina (Mumtaz). But Mohan's father has a different idea about what kind of woman his son should marry. The quest for true love is complicated, especially when Mohan's wacky friends get involved in this madcap comedy from K.P. Atma. The soundtrack features "Aapke Peeche Pad Gayi Mein" and "Chiraag Kiske Ghar Ka Hai Tu Laal Kis Jigar Ka Hai."
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Countess Federica, the elderly owner of a coveted piece of bayside property, is brutally slain by her husband -- who is himself then killed by a mysterious third person. Could the killer be the real estate developer? The neighbor who wants to preserve the area's insect life? Or perhaps the countess's illegitimate son, in a bid to make a name for himself? Brace yourself, because no one's a suspect for very long in this black comedy about greed.
link.title: synopsis
The Black Belly of the Tarantula
5 Dolls for an August Moon / Four Times That Night
The Bird with the Crystal Plumage
What Have You Done to Solange?
All the Colors of the Dark
I Know What You Did Last Summer
The Giallo Collection: Who Saw Her Die?
Elvira's Movie Macabre: Frankenstein's Castle of Freaks
The Gore Gore Girls: Special Edition

link.synopsis: Donna (Stephanee LaFleur) is a frustrated housewife who wonders what her life would be like if she'd married her friend's husband instead of her own. Soon, her fantasies take on a life of their own as she becomes immersed in an erotic world of seduction and pleasure. Donna learns that she can't resist what -- and who -- she desires most while at the same time gaining insight into her own life in this quirky, sexy comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Red Shoe Diaries: The Movie: Special Edition

link.synopsis: Adapted from a play by Wilson Collison and directed by the prolific Allan Dwan (Brewster's Millions, Suez), this romantic comedy features Dennis O'Keefe as a newly married man who suddenly realizes that a gift to a former girlfriend (Marie McDonald) could jeopardize his relationship with his suspicious new wife (Sheila Ryan). During a weekend getaway, he goes to great lengths to get the jewel-encrusted garter back without anyone finding out.
link.title: synopsis
The Adventures of Ma & Pa Kettle: Vol. 1
The Three Stooges: Three Smart Saps
Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House
Deanna Durbin: Three Smart Girls / Something in the Wind
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick
My Friend Irma / My Friend Irma Goes West
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend

link.synopsis: Gopi (M.G. Ramachandran) and his older brother (S.V. Sahasranamam) are best friends. But when Gopi meets the beautiful Radha (Latha) and the two fall in love, he incurs the wrath of a jealous Dorai (M.N. Nambiar). Dorai's determined to get revenge by turning the brothers against each other. Now, Gopi must foil Dorai's plan and teach him a lesson he'll never forget. This Tamil comedy from Shridhar features music by M.S. Viswanathan.
link.title: synopsis
Kal Ho Naa Ho: Tomorrow May Never Come

link.synopsis: Entrepreneurs Colm (Barry McEvoy) and George (Brian F. O'Byrne) are tired of cutting hair in the town prison, so when the man who supplies all the townsfolk with hairpieces is incarcerated, the two partners seize the opportunity to grow a toupee business. The trouble begins when competition arrives and the pair must sell 30 toupees in a race to remain on top in director Barry Levinson's comedy set in Northern Ireland.
link.title: synopsis
Hal Roach: King of Irish Comedy
Phil Ochs: There But for Fortune
The Englishman Who Went Up a Hill but Came Down a Mountain
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
Ghost Dog: The Way of the Samurai

link.synopsis: Set in 1965, this 1980s teen comedy classic stars Tom Cruise as Woody, a high school kid who takes a trip to Tijuana, where he and his buddies aspire to lose their virginity once and for all. Their plans get complicated when the group is joined by a pretty woman in her 20s (Shelley Long) who's headed south of the border in search of a cheap divorce. Curtis Hanson directs; Jackie Earle Haley co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
The Nine Lives of Fritz the Cat

link.synopsis: The 11th release in the "Short" series focuses on extremes of human emotions as depicted in 15 short films. The collection includes the award-winning Hate: A Comedy, which involves a rivalry between a man and a chicken, and Bass on Titles, a documentary that explores the work of acclaimed graphic designer Saul Bass. Also included are Portrait of Jimmy McGriff, HoCoyote, Agony or Ecstasy and more.
link.title: synopsis
The Work of Director Stéphane Sednaoui
The Astonishing Work of Tezuka Osamu
The Work of Director Spike Jonze

link.synopsis: In the 1965 documentary Buster Keaton Rides Again, viewers get a rare chance to hear the silent film star's speaking voice, captured during the shooting of The Railrodder. The latter film -- showcasing Keaton's trademark slapstick comedy -- follows an old man's tour across Canada on a railroad handcart, past the splendor of the country's most spectacular landmarks. It was one of the actor's final films.
link.title: synopsis
The Three Stooges: The Outlaws Is Coming
It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World
Snow White and the Three Stooges
The Three Stooges: Stop, Look and Laugh
The Return of the Pink Panther
Arbuckle & Keaton: The Original Comique Paramount Shorts 1917-1920: Vol. 2
Arbuckle & Keaton: The Original Comique Paramount Shorts 1917-1920: Vol. 1
Slapstick Symposium: The Harold Lloyd Collection 2
Slapstick Symposium: The Harold Lloyd Collection
Martin & Lewis: At War with the Army
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: International House
Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House
The Three Stooges: Nutty but Nice
The Three Stooges: Three Stooges in History
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick
One Night in the Tropics / Buck Privates / In the Navy / Hold That Ghost
The Three Stooges: Healthy, Wealthy and Dumb
The Three Stooges: Soup to Nuts
The Three Stooges: Stooged and Confoosed
Laurel & Hardy: Air Raid Wardens / Nothing But Trouble

title.regular: Buster Keaton Rides Again / The Railrodder
title.short: Buster Keaton Rides Again / The Railrodder

link.synopsis: To fund his ambition of owning a bakery, ex-con Ray Gleason (Ted Danson) plans a heist of rare coins -- which goes off well until Ray's estranged son, Timmy (Macaulay Culkin), turns up and holds the loot hostage in this genial family comedy. Looking to spend quality time with his father, 11-year-old Timmy refuses to give back the cache unless dad goes along with his agenda. Glenne Headly co-stars as the undercover cop who's on Ray's trail.
link.title: synopsis
And You Thought Your Parents Were Weird
Lady and the Tramp II: Scamp's Adventure
National Geographic: Everest: 50 Years on the Mountain
The Neverending Story 3: Escape From Fantasia
The New Adventures of Pippi Longstocking
The Amish: A People of Preservation

link.synopsis: In this romantic comedy, quirky secretary Kinki Kwok (Sammi Cheng) begins working with her new boss, Andy Cheung (Andy Lau), but the sparks don't fly. Kinki believes the rumors about Andy's womanizing -- and he thinks Kinki's a terrible assistant. But a business trip brings them closer together just as Andy's ex-girlfriend (Fiona Leung) decides she wants another round of romance. Meanwhile, a wealthy Internet mogul sets his sights on Kinki
link.title: synopsis
If You Are the One: Love and Marriage

link.synopsis: Porter Stoddard (Warren Beatty) finds himself knee-deep in trouble when he cheats on his wife (Diane Keaton) with the gorgeous Alex (Nastassja Kinski). And his best friend (Garry Shandling) is no help; he's cheating on his wife (Goldie Hawn) with another man! Together, the philandering pair heads to Idaho to escape their troubles -- but midlife malaise and new temptations might just derail the duo in director Peter Chelsom's screwball comedy.
link.title: synopsis
There's a Girl in My Soup
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
A Guide for the Married Man
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
Comedy Express Presents: Al Ducharme: Spineless and Lovin' It

link.synopsis: Tony (Frank Sinatra) is trying to keep his failing Miami hotel afloat while raising his 12-year-old son (Eddie Hodges). As a last resort, he's forced to ask his harried brother, Mario (Edward G. Robinson), for help, but he'll only bail Tony out if he marries a sensible woman. The trouble is, Tony isn't the sensible type -- until he meets Eloise (Eleanor Parker). This classic comedy from Frank Capra features the Oscar-winning song "High Hopes."
link.title: synopsis
Frank Capra's WWII: Why We Fight: American Propaganda Films of WWII
The Man with the Golden Arm: 50th Anniversary Special Edition
There's No Business Like Show Business
Take Me Out to the Ball Game

link.synopsis: Vittorio De Sica stars as Antonio Carotenuto, a middle-aged police chief dispatched to a sleepy Italian village. With little else to command his attention, the handsome Antonio quickly falls for Frisky, the town bombshell (Gina Lollobrigida). But Antonio is one of many men vying for Frisky's affections -- including Pietro (Robert Risso), a shy young officer on his squad. Luigi Comencini directs this Oscar-nominated romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
A Post in White Birch Forest
Yves St. Laurent: His Life and Times
Like a Fish Out of Water
The Loves and Times of Scaramouche

link.synopsis: Pin-up gal and girl next door Betty Grable stars as Glenda Crawford, an American heiress who falls for a dashing South American horse breeder in this musical comedy. Glenda's parents disapprove of Ricardo Quintana (Don Ameche), and the star-crossed lovers face tough odds as they fight for the right to be together. In between all the feuding and fussing are standout song-and-dance numbers by Carmen Miranda and the Nicholas Brothers.
link.title: synopsis
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
Take Me Out to the Ball Game

link.synopsis: This Oscar-nominated comedy follows two couples entered in the London-to-Brighton classic car rally. Their friendly rivalry heats up when during a quarrel, Alan (John Gregson) wagers that he and his wife (Dinah Sheridan) will beat Ambrose (Kenneth More) and his girlfriend (Kay Kendall) to their destination. Not above resorting to acts of sabotage, the two teams race toward the Westminster Bridge in a furious fight to the finish.
link.title: synopsis
Those Daring Young Men in Their Jaunty Jalopies
Bela Lugosi Meets a Brooklyn Gorilla
There's No Business Like Show Business

link.synopsis: Bertrand Blier's unconventional, sophisticated French comedy follows two men -- Raoul (Gerard Depardieu) and Stephane (Patrick Dewaere) -- who try everything to make the insatiable Solange (Carole Laure) happy. But their efforts fail when they lose her to a precocious 13-year-old boy. This critically acclaimed feature was the winner of the 1979 Best Foreign Language Film Oscar.
link.title: synopsis
Moscow Does Not Believe in Tears
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: This charming comedy tells the story of a turn-of-the-century newspaper reporter (Dick Powell) who wishes he could scoop his colleagues by knowing about events before they occur. But when a mysterious old man starts giving him the news a day in advance, his life is turned upside down. Racing to prevent a headline predicting his own death, he gets mixed up with a brilliant fortune-teller (Linda Darnell) and her overprotective uncle (Jack Oakie).
link.title: synopsis
That Wonderful Urge / Love Is News
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
The Adventures of Ma & Pa Kettle: Vol. 1
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: My Little Chickadee

link.synopsis: After taking over a record company with fellow gangsters, mob boss Tony Gordoni (Leo Carrillo) uses strong-arm tactics to convince real-life celebrities to perform on his label, including Cab Calloway, Louis Prima, Joe DiMaggio and Gene Autry. Also featuring appearances by Ted Lewis, Kay Thompson and cowboy comic Max Terhune, this musical comedy includes songs like "I Owe You" and "Manhattan Merry-Go-Round."
link.title: synopsis
The Three Stooges: Three Stooges in History
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: You Can't Cheat an Honest Man
Three Stooges: Stooges and the Law
East Side of Heaven / If I Had My Way
Thank You, Jeeves / Step Lively, Jeeves!
The Three Stooges: Healthy, Wealthy and Dumb
The Three Stooges: Stooged and Confoosed
You Can't Take It with You
The Three Stooges: Cops and Robbers

link.synopsis: Danny Kaye takes on the dual role of Henri Duran, a womanizing French businessman, and Jack Martin, an entertainer who happens to do a perfect impression of Duran in this musical comedy that features Kaye's popular version of "Ballin' the Jack." Martin is hired to impersonate Duran at a party, which leads to a series of comic misunderstandings among Duran's numerous girlfriends. Gene Tierney co-stars.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)

link.title: That Wonderful Urge / Love Is News
With a Song in My Heart
There's No Business Like Show Business
Take Me Out to the Ball Game
By the Light of the Silvery Moon

link.synopsis: A close-knit London neighborhood secedes from England in this remastered Ealing Studios comedy classic starring Stanley Holloway, Margaret Rutherford and Paul Dupuis. Just after the end of World War II, a document is uncovered at a bomb site and proves that Pimlico parish is, in fact, part of the French duchy of Burgundy. When British authorities try to regain control by blockading Pimlico's perimeter, the newly minted French citizens fight back.
link.title: synopsis
The Man in the White Suit
The Adventures of Ma & Pa Kettle: Vol. 1
I Was a Male War Bride
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick
The Man Who Came to Dinner
The Ealing Comedy Collection: Whisky Galore

link.synopsis: After immigrating to the promised land -- the new state of Israel -- Sallah clashes with government officials and his kibbutz community in this 1964 comedy directed by Ephraim Kishon and starring Topol. Disgusted by overbearing bureaucracy and what he feels are unrealistic communal expectations, Sallah (Topol) butts heads with leaders and neighbors as he tries to acquire housing for his family. Gila Almagor and Arik Einstein also star.
link.title: synopsis
Turn Left at the End of the World

link.synopsis: Hard-nosed newspaperman Jim Gannon (the ever-dapper Clark Gable) cleverly pretends to be a night school student to woo beautiful journalism teacher Erica Stone (Doris Day) in this classic romantic comedy directed by George Seaton. Forced by his editor to do a story on journalism courses, Gannon assumes a new name, attends a lecture and is taken with the lovely Erica. After falling for her, he has to get her fiancé (Gig Young) out of the picture.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Clark Gable Collection: The Tall Men
By the Light of the Silvery Moon
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: The sexes battle with wit, verve and bursts of song in this satirical romance. Maurice Chevalier and Jeanette MacDonald star as a womanizer and a man-hungry temptress, charming and chiding each other with naughty innuendo and high comedy. A true cinematic landmark, this 1929 Ernst Lubitsch talkie was the first Hollywood movie to feature songs integrated with the narrative, paving the way for countless musicals to come.
link.title: synopsis
The Love Trap / Directed by William Wyler
The Oyster Princess / I Don't Want to Be a Man
I Am a Fugitive from a Chain Gang
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
Rhythm on the Range / Rhythm on the River: Double Feature
Thirty Day Princess / Kiss and Make Up

link.synopsis: Discharged from the military for medical reasons, World War II hero Marion Scott (Dave O'Brien) is hitchhiking his way home when he's picked up by rich society girl Wilhelmina Hammond (Kay Aldridge), who's fleeing her fiance; in a stolen car. And though sparks immediately fly between the two, the secrets they're hiding from each other might just quash their chance at romance. This madcap comedy earned an Oscar nomination for Best Score.
link.title: synopsis
Juke Joint / Reet, Petite and Gone
Santana: Sacred Fire: Live in Mexico
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
One Night in the Tropics / Buck Privates / In the Navy / Hold That Ghost

link.synopsis: Out-of-work Broadway director Elwin "Bix" Bixby (James Cagney) reluctantly agrees to put on a musical show at West Point starring the producer's (Roland Winters) cadet nephew (Gordon MacRae). But it's hardly smooth sailing as Bix discovers the unique challenges of staging a production. Virginia Mayo and Doris Day co-star in this spunky comedy that's packed with tunes from songwriter Jule Styne and lyricist Sammy Cahn.
link.title: synopsis
There's No Business Like Show Business

link.synopsis: Set during World War I, this quirky silent comedy from director Lewis Milestone (who won an Oscar) chronicles the adventures of incessantly bickering American soldiers W. Dangerfield Phelps (William Boyd) and Peter McGaffney (Louis Wolheim). After Germans capture the two Yanks, they escape by posing as Arabs and soon find themselves stowing away aboard a freighter, where they try to save an Arabian princess (Mary Astor) from a randy sheik.
link.title: synopsis
The Mark of Zorro / Don Q: Son of Zorro
All Quiet on the Western Front
Slapstick Symposium: The Harold Lloyd Collection 2
Slapstick Symposium: The Harold Lloyd Collection
Why Change Your Wife? / Miss Lulu Bett
The Harold Lloyd Comedy Collection: Vol. 3
The Harold Lloyd Comedy Collection: Vol. 2
Slapstick Symposium: The Charley Chase Collection 2
The Toll Gate / His Bitter Pill
The Master Mystery / Terror Island / The Man from Beyond
Switchblade Symphony: Phantom of the Opera

link.synopsis: Ex-couple Richard (Dick Van Dyke) and Barbara (Debbie Reynolds) Harmon come to realize that after the trials and tribulations of dating, debilitating alimony payouts and commiserations with fellow divorcées, married life isn't so bad after all. Eileen Brennan, Joe Flynn, Van Johnson, Jean Simmons and Jason Robards co-star in director Bud Yorkin's dark comedy about the paralyzing process of splitting up.
link.title: synopsis
Dick Van Dyke: In Rare Form
Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River
A Big Hand for the Little Lady

link.synopsis: Bessie and "Slug" Winters (Patsy Kelly and Jack Haley) are husband-and-wife college football coaches trying to rebuild their team in this Oscar-nominated musical comedy. They find their new hero in hayseed Amos Dodd (Stuart Erwin), whose melon-tossing skills could lead them to the championship. Pigskin Parade features the songs "It's Love I'm After," "Down with Everything" and "We'd Rather Be in College" and was Judy Garland's feature film debut.
link.title: synopsis
East Side of Heaven / If I Had My Way
The Big Broadcast of 1938 / College Swing
Rhythm on the Range / Rhythm on the River: Double Feature

link.synopsis: Bachelors Pierre (Roland Giraud), Michel (Michel Boujenah) and Jacques (Andre Dussollier) have their lives turned upside down when an infant houseguest is dropped at their doorstep, apparently the product of one of Jacques's flings. Caring for the baby until her mother (Philippine Leroy-Beaulieu) returns, the first-time fathers get a crash course in parenting. This French comedy inspired the Hollywood hit Three Men and a Baby.
link.title: synopsis
Moscow Does Not Believe in Tears
Three Men and a Little Lady
Jean de Florette / Manon of the Spring

link.synopsis: In this surreal romantic comedy from New Zealand, Lucinda (Danielle Cormack) puts her relationship with her dairy farmer fiancé, Rob (Karl Urban), on the line when she goes to great lengths to retrieve a favorite quilt swiped by a mysterious woman named Auntie (Rangi Motu). Without thinking, Lucinda trades Rob's cows for the quilt, and pandemonium ensues. Ultimately, director Harry Sinclair's edgy fable asks: Does love conquer all?
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Undercover cop Leung Foon (Nick Cheung) is having trouble taking down the illegal trading operation headed by crime boss Ferrari (Wong Jing). So to accomplish his mission, he asks for help from the renowned Master Wong (Stephen Chow), an expert in gambling tricks. Although the "Tricky Master" is opposed to getting involved, Foon convinces him to help bring down the swindler in a zany comedy that spoofs Enter the Dragon and The Matrix.
link.title: synopsis
God of Gamblers III: Back to Shanghai
My Wife Is a Gambling Maestro
The Jet Li Collection: Evil Cult / Dr. Wai
Revenge of the Kung Fu Master
Ninja in the Claw of the CIA

link.synopsis: In this Italian/West German dark comedy, mad butcher Otto Lehman (Victor Buono) tries to regain his status as "best butcher in Vienna" after being released from a mental hospital. In a fit of rage over his wife's nagging, however, Otto strangles the woman (Franca Polesello) and disposes of her body by adding it to his famous sausage. Soon, other people in Otto's life start "disappearing" -- and the sausages keep getting tastier.
link.title: synopsis
Death Curse of Tartu / Sting of Death: Double Feature
The Giallo Collection: The Case of the Bloody Iris
Angels / Getting into Heaven: Double Feature
The Barn of the Naked Dead
My Baby Is Black! / Checkerboard: Double Feature
The Black Belly of the Tarantula
The Bird with the Crystal Plumage
What Have You Done to Solange?
5 Dolls for an August Moon / Four Times That Night
The Giallo Collection: Who Saw Her Die?
The Giallo Collection: The Bloodstained Shadow
All the Colors of the Dark

link.synopsis: Lured by a travel agent's flowery descriptions of the deluxe accommodations at Club Sand, the harried George Lollar (Charles Grodin) drags his family to the Caribbean, where the beds turn out to be army cots and the staff is anything but attentive. Phil Hartman, Jon Lovitz, Megan Mullally and Mario Van Peebles co-star in this slapstick vacation comedy from the writers of Revenge of the Nerds.
link.title: synopsis
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise
Twilight of the Ice Nymphs / Archangel
If It's Tuesday, It Still Must be Belgium
The Zany Adventures of Robin Hood
National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation 2: Cousin Eddie's Island Adventure
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Manos: The Hands of Fate

link.synopsis: Trampy femme fatale Jewel Valentine (Liv Tyler) nonchalantly lures three guys into her criminal strategy of happy homemaking: horny bartender Randy (Matt Dillon), arrogant lawyer Carl (Paul Reiser) and guilt-ridden Det. Dehling (John Goodman). They are all mesmerized by her wiles, but will Ms. Valentine gets what she wants? Harald Zwart directs this comedy that features Andrew Dice Clay in a dual role.
link.title: synopsis
I Love You, Alice B. Toklas!
Andrew Dice Clay: One Night with Dice
The Ealing Comedy Collection: Whisky Galore

link.synopsis: Simple suicide is harder than it seems in this independent comedy from director David Flanagan. Kevin (Matthew Aldrich) wants to end his life, but he just doesn't have the nerve. When he meets Molly (Michelle Thompson), she promises to help him if he agrees to deliver a message to her dead boyfriend. So with Kevin's permission, Molly hires two bungling mechanics to do the job -- but they just don't have the skills to kill.
link.title: synopsis
Louise Hay: You Can Heal Your Life: The Movie: Expanded Version
Diary of a Mad Black Woman: The Play

link.synopsis: Set in a Brazilian backwater, this low-key comedy stars Regina Casé as spirited Darlene, who ends up in a casual ménage with three men -- all under the same roof -- after accepting an impromptu marriage proposal from her neighbor Osias (Lima Duarte). When it's clear that he just wants a live-in housekeeper, Darlene turns to other men … namely, his cousin (Stênio Garcia) and a young drifter (Luiz Carlos Vasconcelos) who move in with the couple.
link.title: synopsis
The Year My Parents Went on Vacation
Love for Sale: Suely in the Sky
Once Upon a Time in Rio
To the Left of the Father
The Other Side of the Bed
How Much Do You Love Me?
The Other Side of the Street
Blood and Wine: A Brazilian Story

link.synopsis: As a favor to married best friend Ethan (David Wenham), soft-boiled Aussie private eye Harvey (Hugo Weaving) grudgingly agrees to wed Ethan's mistress -- a spirited Russian named Katia (Natasha Novak) whose visa is about to expire -- in this quirky romantic comedy. It seems that Ethan isn't ready to say goodbye to Katia ... or to leave his wife (Rebecca Frith). But all bets are off when Harvey finds himself falling in love with Katia.
link.title: synopsis
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: When a dangerous criminal moves into a quiet suburban neighborhood, the police ask grizzled cop Jack Stone (Jack Palance) to set up a stakeout next door. The only catch is that Jack will have to live with the Robbersons, a quirky family led by a bumbling cop wanna-be (Chevy Chase). If the Robbersons don't drive him crazy, Jack just might be able to catch the bad guy in this comedy co-starring Dianne Wiest.
link.title: synopsis
So I Married an Axe Murderer
See No Evil, Hear No Evil
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie
City Slickers II: The Legend of Curly's Gold

link.synopsis: Director David Caesar's dark comedy of errors revolves around hapless best friends Kev (Ben Mendelsohn) and Mick (Jeremy Sims), two unemployed losers who spend each and every day of their uneventful lives watching violent TV shows in a beer-induced stupor. Inspired by their favorite crime shows and constant lack of money, the dim-witted pair decides to rob a bank -- and launch themselves headfirst into the world's most idiotic heist.
link.title: synopsis
Henry Rollins: Live in the Conversation Pit
Yucko the Clown: The Damn Show
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
Village of the Damned / Children of the Damned
The Thin Blue Line: The Complete Lineup
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels

link.synopsis: Professional football players Billy Puckett (Burt Reynolds) and Marvin "Shake" Tiller (Kris Kristofferson) are good ol' boys and best friends on and off the field. They enjoy nothing more than a little competition, especially when it comes to the team owner's daughter, Barbara Jane (Jill Clayburgh). But their problems are no match for a little group therapy in this quirky comedy based on Dan Jenkins's novel.
link.title: synopsis
I'm Dancing as Fast as I Can
Pat Garrett and Billy the Kid
The Life and Hard Times of Guy Terrifico

link.synopsis: Ollie (Steven Peacock Jacoby) is a stone-cold player who's always had a way with the ladies. But all that changes when Mona (Ruby Campbell) moves to town. Ollie's in love, but Mona's not as easy a conquest as he's used to. Ollie's friends, including the smooth-talking Top Cat (Trevor David), offer more than their fair share of advice. But their guidance may do more harm than good in this award-wining comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Lon Chaney Collection: The Unknown
The Best of The Steve Harvey Show
Masterpiece Classic: A Room With a View

link.synopsis: Veteran bounty hunter Ralph "Papa" Thorson (Steve McQueen, in his final film role) goes on a series of downright dangerous searches to bring in the bad guys in this action film (with some comedy sprinkled in) based on the real-life bounty hunter Thorson. With each life-threatening incident in the line of duty, Thorson questions his chosen profession and his longevity in it. Kathryn Harrold plays Thorson's pregnant girlfriend, Dotty.
link.title: synopsis
The Great St. Louis Bank Robbery
In the Line of Duty: The FBI Murders

link.synopsis: John-John (Marques Houston) is throwing the house party to end all house parties. The only problem is, the house isn't his! While his music mogul uncle is away, John-John plans to play, play, play. But when his jealous sister finds out about his plans, she'll go to almost length to get him in trouble. Now, John-John just has to get the house back in order before his uncle returns in this hip-hop comedy co-starring Alexis Fields and Meagan Good.
link.title: synopsis
Revenge of the Nerds III: The Next Generation
Ring of Fire: The Emile Griffith Story
WWE: The Rise and Fall of WCW
The Fresh Prince of Bel Air
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th
Romy and Michele's High School Reunion
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd

title.regular: House Party 4: Down to the Last Minute
title.short: House Party 4: Down to the Last Minute

link.synopsis: A year in the making, this unique miniseries has been hailed as the definitive guide to the human face. Hosted by John Cleese, four episodes examine the face from every angle -- cultural, historical, biological, physiological and psychological. Combining comedy sketches with serious interviews, this innovative exploration of the human face is conveyed in simple yet interesting terms, all infused with Cleese's intelligent wit.
link.title: synopsis
Attenborough in Paradise and Other Personal Voyages
Prehistoric America: A Journey Through the Ice Age and Beyond
The Secret Life of the Brain
Into the Universe with Stephen Hawking
Simon Schama: The Power of Art
In Search of the Trojan War
Prehistoric Planet: The Complete Dino Dynasty
Dragon's World: A Fantasy Made Real
BBC Atlas of the Natural World: Spirits of the Jaguar
BBC Atlas of the Natural World: Wild South America
Secrets of Lost Empires II: Nova
Great Artists Two with Tim Marlow
The Private Life of a Masterpiece: Masterpieces 1800 to 1850
The Private Life of a Masterpiece: Masterpieces of Sculpture
The Private Life of a Masterpiece: Masterpieces of the Twentieth Century
The Private Life of a Masterpiece: Renaissance Masterpieces
The Private Life of a Masterpiece: Seventeenth Century Masters

link.synopsis: In this teen comedy, high school student Benny King (Jermaine "Huggy" Hopkins) is spending a boring summer flipping burgers. But that all changes when his old friend Durrell (Brian Hooks) shows up; Benny borrows his father's Mercedes; and the duo heads to the beach to hawk cheap sunglasses. Once there, however, the boys find they're more interested in beach and bikinis than selling shades. Hip-hop star Coolio appears in a cameo role.
link.title: synopsis
The Fresh Prince of Bel Air
House Party 4: Down to the Last Minute
An Alan Smithee Film: Burn Hollywood Burn
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th

link.synopsis: After Dr. John Richards (Hannes Jaenicke) invents a revolutionary device that can move large objects by scrambling their atoms, his assistant kidnaps him, hoping to make millions. Richards's son, Jackie (Harrison Myers), and wife, Barbara (Mary Elizabeth McGlynn), must team up to thwart the culprits. While trying to rescue her husband, Barbara accidentally turns herself invisible, which she uses to her full advantage in this sci-fi comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Now You See Him, Now You Don't
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Original Series
Dr. Seuss' The Cat in the Hat

link.synopsis: While giving her high school graduation address, Renata Deveroux of Wilbur Falls shocks the audience with her strange tale of the "disappearance" of the school's star athlete (Charlie Newmark). Also known as Wilbur Falls, Dead Silence is a quirky small-town comedy with a dash of "Twin Peaks." The flick features Shanee Edwards ("3rd Rock from the Sun") as Renata and Danny Aiello as her bewildered dad, Phil.
link.title: synopsis
Neil Gaiman's A Short Film About John Bolton
The Good, the Bad and the Beautiful / The Bikini Academy
Assassination of a High School President
Romy and Michele's High School Reunion
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love
House Party 4: Down to the Last Minute

link.synopsis: Reminiscent of director Pedro Almodovar's early films, this anarchic Spanish sex comedy begins when the other half of Gloria's (Verónica Forqué's) live S&M act falls ill. Scrambling to find a replacement, she corrals a young man named Manu (Jorge Sanz) to stand in. Impressed by his youthful vigor, Gloria hires him -- an act she comes to regret when his well-to-do parents learn of his new job.
link.title: synopsis
What Have I Done to Deserve This?
De Que Se Rien Las Mujeres?
How to be a Woman and not Die in the Attempt
The Other Side of the Bed

title.regular: Why Do They Call It Love When They Mean Sex?
title.short: Why Call It Love When They Mean Sex?

link.synopsis: Fluffier than cotton candy, this 1960s German musical comedy follows a group of teenage girls heading to the Baltic coast together for their summer vacation. Inevitably, they wind up mingling with a group of saucy teenage guys, giving way to quarrels and flirtatious competitions that are played out in lively song-and-dance numbers (think Grease with a German twist). Stars former East German pop idols Chris Boerk and Frank Schobel.
link.title: synopsis
The Good, the Bad, the Weird
Beresina oder Die letzten Tage der Schweiz
The Giallo Collection: The Bloodstained Shadow
In the Dust of the Stars
SCTV: Best of the Early Years

link.synopsis: In this stinging indictment of Mexican politics disguised as a screwball comedy, Elena (Julieta Egurrola) finds out the truth about her philandering husband, Dr. Enrique Laguardia (Fernando Luján), when his secretary uncovers his secret life as a drug smuggler and money launderer (he works for Con and Trix Corp.). The film won multiple awards (including Best Film, Actor and Actress) at the Guadalajara Film Festival.
link.title: synopsis

title.regular: In the Country where Nothing Happens
title.short: In the Country where Nothing Happens

link.synopsis: The inaugural volume in this series, featuring live stand-up comedy from the biggest names in the business, takes you to many of the hottest venues around in pursuit of some serious belly laughs. Unique footage captures some of the greatest bits from performers such as Tim Allen, Jim Carrey, Richard Lewis, Carrot Top, Diane Ford, Caroline Rhea, Louie Anderson, Cheech Marin, Richard Belzer and more.
link.title: synopsis
Comic Relief: The Greatest... And the Latest
The Original Latin Kings of Comedy
The Shakiest Gun in the West / The Love God?: Double Feature
Platinum Comedy Series: Paul Rodriguez: Live in San Quentin
Billy Cobham: Culturemix: New Morning Paris Concert
Secret NASA Transmissions 2: We Are Not Alone
Homicide: Life on the Street: Season 4
Homicide: Life on the Street: Seasons 1 & 2
Guy Torry's Phat Comedy Tuesdays: Vol. 1
Anjelah Johnson: That's How We Do It
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet
Assume the Position with Mr. Wuhl

link.synopsis: Catch big-name comics Chris Rock, D.L. Hughley, Norm MacDonald, Jason Alexander and Paul Rodriguez before they hit the height of their fame with this stand-up showcase that brings comedy club laughs directly to your doorstep. You'll be laughing out loud with a lineup that also includes sharp-witted observations about the insanity of everyday life from comedians Rhonda Shear, Bruce Bannin, Jeff Altman and John Fox.
link.title: synopsis
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 1
George Carlin: Jammin' in New York
Gabriel Iglesias: I'm Not Fat ... I'm Fluffy
Laugh Bandits: No. 1: Gerald Kelly: Live in New York City
Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour: The Best of Season 3
Rodney Dangerfield: No Respect: The Ultimate Collection
The Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle
Guy Torry's Phat Comedy Tuesdays: Vol. 1
Anjelah Johnson: That's How We Do It
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Chris Rock
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet
Assume the Position with Mr. Wuhl

link.synopsis: Comic heavyweights Drew Carey and Tom Arnold are just two of the stand-up talents who deliver hilarious routines in this fourth installment of the Laughing Out Loud series, which brings comedy club yuks straight to your living room. Also uncorking choice bits are wisecrackers Laura Kightlinger, Bobby Collins, John Mulrooney, Marty Putz, Dennis Wolfberg, Jenny Jones and the appropriately named Bob Zany.
link.title: synopsis
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
John Pinette: I Say Nay Nay
Steven Wright: When the Leaves Blow Away
Comic Relief: The Greatest... And the Latest
Mike Birbiglia: What I Should Have Said Was Nothing: Tales From My Secret Public Journal
The Best of Abbott and Costello: Vol. 3
The Comedians of Comedy: The Movie
Guy Torry's Phat Comedy Tuesdays: Vol. 1
Anjelah Johnson: That's How We Do It
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet
Assume the Position with Mr. Wuhl

link.synopsis: Boasting some of the greatest names in stand-up comedy, film and television, this hilarious collection of stage performances from the late 1980s and early '90s is guaranteed to have you laughing till it hurts. Among the comedians featured in this release are Adam Sandler, Jeff Foxworthy, Janeane Garofalo, the Legendary Wid, Steve McGrew, the Unknown Comic, Daryl Hammond, Ray Romano and Ellen DeGeneres.
link.title: synopsis
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Working Class Comics
Red Green's: We Can't Help It -- We're Men
Wait Till Your Father Gets Home: Season 1
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Adam Sandler
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie
Guy Torry's Phat Comedy Tuesdays: Vol. 1
Anjelah Johnson: That's How We Do It

link.synopsis: Featuring many of the biggest names in stand-up comedy, film and television, this uproarious collection of stage performances from the late 1980s and early '90s is guaranteed to make you laugh till it hurts. Among the jokers on the docket are Jerry Seinfeld, Jeff Foxworthy, Rosie O'Donnell, Kelsey Grammer, Adam Sandler, Max Alexander, John Caponera, John Ferrantino, Judy Tentua and Carol Leifer.
link.title: synopsis
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Working Class Comics
Jeff Foxworthy: You Might Be a Redneck / Check Your Neck
Vader: And Blood Was Shed in Warsaw
Bill Engvall: A Decade of Laughs
Between God, the Devil and a Winchester / Boot Hill
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Adam Sandler
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie
Guy Torry's Phat Comedy Tuesdays: Vol. 1
Anjelah Johnson: That's How We Do It
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet
Assume the Position with Mr. Wuhl

link.synopsis: Greenwich Village butcher Leo Lemke (George Dzundza) returns from a North Carolina fishing trip with his clairvoyant new wife, Marina (Demi Moore). Soon, she's inspiring hardened Gothamites with her prophecies -- and scaring her hubby, who sends her to the neighborhood shrink (Jeff Daniels). But Leo's plan may backfire when Marina starts to suspect she wed the wrong guy in this whimsical comedy co-starring Mary Steenburgen.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: After a stint in the underground world of amateur backyard wrestling, buddies Cole Davis (Scott Hamm) and Lee Takura (Walter Jones) enlist foxy promoter Kristy James (Bree Turner) to chronicle their exploits on the Internet -- and the duo soon becomes a cybersensation. But as their fame grows, so do the grappling challenges in this wild action comedy also starring Dale Evans as the evil Voodoo Jones.
link.title: synopsis
Cheating Death, Stealing Life: The Eddie Guerrero Story
The Rise and Fall of ECW
Raped By an Angel 2:The Uniform Fan
He Sees You When You're Sleeping
The Haunted World of El Superbeasto

link.synopsis: This collection of installments from the irreverent Comedy Central series features four misadventures that follow foul-mouthed quartet Eric, Kyle, Kenny and Stan as the gang stirs things up in South Park. Stories include the Backstreet Boys and 'N Sync taking a satirical hit to the solar plexus, Eric trying to hasten puberty, the boys saving Christmas and an equal-opportunity offender episode that mocks race relations and political correctness.
link.title: synopsis
South Park: The Cult of Cartman
South Park: A Very Buttery Collection
South Park: The Passion of the Jew
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
The Man Show Presents: Girls on Trampolines
The Man Show Boy / Household Hints from Adult Film Stars
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
The Worst Week of My Life
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Saturday TV Funhouse
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Eddie Murphy
Kathy Griffin: My Life on the D-List

link.synopsis: Bringing together memorable scenes from Bollywood movies, this collection features popular musical numbers such as Mohabbatein's "Humko Humise Chura Lo," Zubeidaa's "Dheeme Dheeme," Refugee's "Aisa Lagta Hai" and Gaja Gamini's "Do Sadiyon Ke Gaja." In addition to romantic dramas such as Mohabbatein and Zubeidaa, this compilation presents clips from the college comedy Kuch Kuch Hota Hai and the action film Deewane.
link.title: synopsis
Bugaboo: Life and Times in the Silicon Valley
Tony Bennett: The Music Never Ends
Kal Ho Naa Ho: Tomorrow May Never Come

link.synopsis: Isha (Kirti Reddy) is a young student who attracts the obsessive attentions of everyone she meets, including those of her sponsor, Yash (Sunil Shetty), and her goofy host, Taj (Aftab Shivdasani). Desperate, Yash hires a young model/actor (Arjun Rampal) to seduce and dump Isha -- so that he can be there to pick up the pieces. But Yash finds there aren't any pieces left to pick up in this quirky romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: This frothy 1950s Bollywood comedy casts three Kumars (Ashok, Kishore and Anup) as car-mechanic brothers running from amorous attachments. Plans for permanent bachelorhood are foiled when the lovely and stranded Renu (Madhubala) putters into one brother's life. The siblings come to blows over the affair until another brother's lost love is recovered after being held by the mob. Happy endings ensue after the bad guys take a beating.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Infamous Rat-Packers Frank Sinatra and Dean Martin team up for a zany, Wild West adventure. Zack Thomas (Frank Sinatra) and Joe Jarrett (Dean Martin) knock 'em back -- and knock 'em out -- as business rivals looking to make a quick buck in 1870s Galviston, Texas, with the help of their lady friends (Anita Ekburg and Ursula Andress). Victor Buono, Charles Bronson and the Three Stooges add to the mayhem in this quick-draw comedy classic.
link.title: synopsis
Live and Swingin': The Ultimate Rat Pack Collection
Judy, Frank and Dean: Once in a Lifetime
Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour: The Best of Season 3
Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
The Good, the Bad and the Ugly

link.synopsis: Young Sean McNutt (Will Keenan) -- a slacker waiter who works at a Mafia-run Italian eatery with carping customers and thieving busboys -- is shaken out of his rut when his pretty girlfriend (Hannah Dalton) dumps him for a slimy yuppie. But Sean's plan to get his life back on track hits more than a few snags in this zany indie comedy featuring cameos by porn legend Ron Jeremy and Troma Studios schlockmeister Lloyd Kaufman.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Despite being a happily married mother of two, Kathy (Harley Jane Kozak) has always wondered what it would've been like to sleep with her high school sweetheart, Tom (Ken Wahl). Her solution: send her best friend, Emily (Elizabeth McGovern), to seduce him and report back with all the juicy details. This romantic comedy also stars Bill Pullman as Kathy's husband and Brad Pitt as Emily's artist boyfriend.
link.title: synopsis
Did You Hear About the Morgans?
Glorious Greens: Broccoli, Asparagus & Artichokes: Vol. 3
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: In director John Pasquin's comedy, Joe Scheffer (Tim Allen) is humiliated when office bully Mark McKinney (Patrick Warburton) punches him out in the company parking lot. Determined to win back his dignity, Joe learns karate and challenges McKinney to a fight. His boldness impresses his co-workers and even his bosses -- but Joe soon must weigh the allure of his newfound status against the love and respect of those who liked him as he was.
link.title: synopsis
Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit

link.synopsis: Inspired by the live-action sci-fi comedy Evolution, this children's cartoon follows the movie's heroes -- Dr. Ira Kane (Kirby Morrow), Dr. Harry Block (Cusse Mankuma) and Wayne Grey (Andrew Francis) -- as they try to stop a rapidly evolving alien species from overrunning the Earth. This video features "Survival," the first episode of the animated series, which originally aired in three parts.
link.title: synopsis
Starship Troopers 2: Hero of the Federation
Chesterfield Kings: Where is the Chesterfield King?
Mom and Dad Save the World
The Alien Conspiracy: Beyond the Lost World

link.synopsis: Adrienne Shelly directs and stars in this offbeat black comedy about a city girl in trouble. After witnessing a string of identical murders, New Yorker Donna (Shelly) begins to wonder if she's lost her mind. Donna tells her boyfriend (Tim Guinea) about the murders, but he's only interested in books so she sets out on her own to determine whether they were real. Along the way, she encounters a cast of quirky characters.
link.title: synopsis
Gaumont Treasures: The Films of Louis Feuillade
Possible Films: Short Works by Hal Hartley 1994-2004
Assassination of a High School President

link.synopsis: These smokers are definitely bad for your health! A group of outcast prep school girls decide to turn the tables on some obnoxious guys by sexually humiliating them … at gunpoint! A black comedy in the mold of Heathers, The Smokers stars Dominique Swain and Keri Lynn Pratt as two of the gun-toting femmes with vengeance on their minds -- and corncobs in hand!
link.title: synopsis
The Dangerous Lives of Altar Boys

link.synopsis: Independent film favorite Hal Hartley directs this trio of shorts about the ups and downs of love. The main featurette, Surviving Desire, is a critically acclaimed romantic comedy about what happens when disillusioned college professor Jude (Martin Donovan) falls hard for Sofie (Mary Ward), one of his literature students. Also included are two other lesser known -- but no less quirky -- Hartley works, Theory of Achievement and Ambition.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: As part of a series profiling some of Hollywood's most important directors, this documentary follows the careers of David Zucker, his brother Jerry and their friend Jim Abrahams. In 1969, the trio created Kentucky Fried Theatre, a comedy troupe showcasing the zany style that became their trademark. In the following years, the trio has directed a slew of hits, including Airplane, Top Secret!, Ruthless People, Hot Shots and the Naked Gun series.
link.title: synopsis
The Work of Director Stéphane Sednaoui
The Work of Director Anton Corbijn
The Annapolis Book of Seamanship: Vol. 3: Safety at Sea
Al Di Meola / Stanley Clarke / Jean-Luc Ponty: Live at Montreux 1994
The Cutting Edge: The Magic of Movie Editing
Empires: Peter and Paul and the Christian Revolution
Martin Scorsese Presents: The Blues: A Musical Journey
Scottsboro: An American Tragedy: American Experience
Clint Eastwood: Out of the Shadows
Empires: The Medici, Godfathers of the Renaissance
With God on Our Side: George W. Bush and the Rise of the Religious Right in America
Anne Frank: The Life of a Young Girl
Beethoven: The Sound and the Fury
Rameses: Wrath of God or Man?
ABC News Presents: Pope John Paul II: His Life and Legacy

link.synopsis: This uproarious comedy from director Blake Edwards follows the romantic exploits of part-time sculptor -- and full-time lothario -- David Fowler (Burt Reynolds), who suffers a midlife crisis that leads him to bed a series of beautiful women. To cope, he turns to an attractive psychiatrist (Julie Andrews) who gives him a new lease on life. Kim Basinger and Sela Ward are among the ladies Fowler seduces.
link.title: synopsis
The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas
The Virgin Queen of St. Francis High

link.synopsis: On the way to his wedding, ex-con Jesse (Luke Wilson) stops at a bank so his groomsman Billy (Sean Patrick Flanery) can make a withdrawal. No problem, except Billy is a bank robber, and soon, Jesse's entire oddball wedding party is involved in the heist. Things become increasingly surreal when the hostages they take side with their captors against the town sheriff and the FBI. Drew Barrymore co-stars in this off-the-wall comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels

link.synopsis: It's mayhem in Argentina! Again! Set in the hypothetical town of Colonia Vela, the film sets off as a farcical comedy about rightist Peronists plotting to oust the leftist Peronist mayor in town. But the mayor doesn't take it lying down. Soon this local political dispute erupts into full blown dirty little war complete with death squads, hostages and torture.
link.title: synopsis
The Dark Side of the Heart
Eighth Annual Media That Matters Film Festival
Last Man Standing: Politics - Texas Style: POV
What Have I Done to Deserve This?
El Lado Oscuro del Corazon II

link.synopsis: From south of the border comes a sexy comedy of social mores and deceptions. Dona Herlinda (Guadalupe del Toro) is a wealthy widow from Guadalajara, Mexico, who's long tolerated the unconventional relationship of her son Rudolfo (Marco Antonio Trevino) and his "significant other," Ramon (Arturo Meza). She even invites Ramon to live with them. But the complications turn hilarious when Rudolfo asks an open-minded young lady to marry him.
link.title: synopsis
The Map of Sex and Love
Evil Come Evil Go / Terror at Orgy Castle / The Hand of Pleasure: Triple Feature
The Other Side of the Bed

link.synopsis: Cannes Best Actor Award winner Tony Leung Chiu Wai stars in this romantic comedy directed by James Yuen. Leung is Wai, a womanizing image consultant who has a tendency to fall in love with his star creations. Now, Wai has finally found his match in his latest overnight sensation, Yu. But there's one slight problem: Wai's boss, Vivian, is also attracted to him. …
link.title: synopsis
Hero Beyond the Boundary of Time
The Golden Lotus: Love and Desire

link.synopsis: A far-out comedy about the last three people on Earth and their terrible relationship problems. Alan (David Arnott) is a chubby, socially inept anthropology student making "a serious documentary on how not to screw up the Earth." Alan's vying with Raphael (Dan Montgomery) -- who's far more graceful and distinguished -- for the affections of hottie Sarah (Jeri Ryan). Sounds as though a threesome would solve everything!
link.title: synopsis
Let it Rock: At the Crossroads of Rock and Roll
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: In Harry Shearer's tongue-in-cheek comedy, a waiter at Zanbesu Glen (a chi-chi Northern California resort) uses his movie camera to spy on the annual communal vacation of a group of rich, white U.S. government and business leaders who drink and carouse to excess while plotting their next move on the global stage. His goal? To sell the embarrassing and incriminating footage to the media and expose the "leaders" for what they really are.

link.synopsis: Spencer Rice and Kenny Hotz, two floundering filmmakers and childhood friends, try to pitch their comedy script to Hollywood bigwigs who've gathered at the Toronto International Film Festival. They'll stop at nothing to get face time with Al Pacino, Matt Dillon and even film critic Roger Ebert. A rollicking farce, Pitch stands firmly in the tradition of Hollywood satires such as Robert Altman's The Player.

link.synopsis: A Hip-Hop comedy about two inspiring musicians trying to record and pitch their song to record producers. Anyone who knows the music business knows how hard this process can be. Along the way, their pranks get them into some hilarious situations and chases.

link.synopsis: The lurid title of this black comedy comes from a New York Post headline for the story on which this film is based. A gunman robs a seedy, topless bar late at night and shoots the bartender in the head. Alternately charming and insane, the robber makes the remaining patrons do his bidding -- dancing, playing "Truth or Dare" and revealing their dirtiest secrets -- as he contemplates killing them.

What's Love Got to Do with It
King of New York: Special Edition
The Messenger: The Story of Joan of Arc

link.synopsis: Uncensored. Wild. Crazy. Colin's Sleazy Friends is one outrageous television show you don't want to miss! This video features today's hottest film, comedy, music and adult stars, including appearances by Blink 182, Glenn Danzig, Jack Black, The Deftones, Kid Rock and more. Also includes a complete episode of Colin's Sleazy Friends, with porn superstar Asia Carrera and The Man Show hosts Adam Carolla and Jimmy Kimmel.

link.synopsis: This Chinese comedy centers on human nature when it comes to love and the pursuit of happiness. When a matchmaker sends middle-aged Zhao (Zhao Benshan) the perfect wife, he tries to impress her by promising a far more extravagant wedding than he can afford. Then, desperate to make money, laid-off factory worker Zhao gets mired in a hilarious, tangled mess before he decides to come clean to his fiancée.

Riding Alone for Thousands of Miles
Detective Dee and the Mystery of the Phantom Flame
Kal Ho Naa Ho: Tomorrow May Never Come

link.synopsis: After losing his lucrative job and his superficial columnist girlfriend (Denise Richards) who leaves town with another guy, brash investment broker Ryan Turner (Charlie Sheen) -- up the creek and desperate for cash -- decides to ghostwrite her advice column. Turner's charade works like a charm ... until the column becomes a huge success. Co-stars Angie Harmon, Jon Lovitz and Rosanna Arquette add to the fun in this engaging romantic comedy.

The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
